label: cor-vvarx-to-high-error-fraction
title: A Large Intra-Swarm Positional Variance Guarantees a Non-Vanishing High-Error Fraction
nl_statement: For fixed interaction range ε > 0, there exists variance threshold R²_total_var,x > 0 and constant f_H(ε) > 0 such that if total intra-swarm positional variance V_Var,x > R²_total_var,x, then the fraction of alive walkers in the high-error set H_k(ε) for at least one swarm k ∈ {1,2} satisfies |H_k(ε)| / N_k ≥ f_H(ε) > 0.
content_markdown:
:label: cor-vvarx-to-high-error-fraction

For any fixed interaction range $\varepsilon > 0$, there exists a positional variance threshold $R^2_{\text{total\_var},x} > 0$ and a corresponding N-uniform constant $f_H(\epsilon) > 0$ such that:

If the total intra-swarm positional variance is large, $V_{\text{Var},x} > R^2_{\text{total\_var},x}$, then the fraction of *alive* walkers in the unified high-error set of at least one of the swarms, $k \in {1, 2}$, is bounded below:

$$
\frac{|H_k(\epsilon)|}{k} \ge f_H(\epsilon) > 0
raw_directive:
2806: This corollary provides the final, synthesized result of our geometric analysis. It proves that a large **total intra-swarm positional variance ($V_{\text{Var},x}$)** is sufficient to guarantee that a non-vanishing fraction of at least one of the swarms belongs to this high-error set, providing the clean, unified input required for the subsequent analysis. This directly aligns with the Keystone Principle's central thesis: the cloning operator contracts the positional variance component of the Lyapunov function.
2807: 
2808: :::{prf:corollary} A Large Intra-Swarm Positional Variance Guarantees a Non-Vanishing High-Error Fraction
2809: :label: cor-vvarx-to-high-error-fraction
2810: 
2811: For any fixed interaction range $\varepsilon > 0$, there exists a positional variance threshold $R^2_{\text{total\_var},x} > 0$ and a corresponding N-uniform constant $f_H(\epsilon) > 0$ such that:
2812: 
2813: If the total intra-swarm positional variance is large, $V_{\text{Var},x} > R^2_{\text{total\_var},x}$, then the fraction of *alive* walkers in the unified high-error set of at least one of the swarms, $k \in {1, 2}$, is bounded below:
2814: 
2815: $$
2816: \frac{|H_k(\epsilon)|}{k} \ge f_H(\epsilon) > 0
2817: $$

hypotheses.text: Exists positional variance threshold R²_total_var,x > 0 and N-uniform constant f_H(ε) > 0
Total intra-swarm positional variance is large: V_Var,x > R²_total_var,x

conclusion.text: Fraction of alive walkers in unified high-error set of at least one swarm k ∈ {1,2} is bounded below: |H_k(ε)| / N_k ≥ f_H(ε) > 0

variables.name: interaction range
variables.description: Fixed positive interaction range parameter

variables.name: positional variance threshold
variables.description: Threshold for total intra-swarm positional variance

variables.name: high-error fraction constant
variables.description: N-uniform positive constant bounding the high-error fraction

variables.name: total intra-swarm positional variance
variables.description: Measure of positional spread within swarms

variables.name: unified high-error set
variables.description: Set of alive walkers in high-error configuration for swarm k

variables.name: number of alive walkers in swarm k
variables.description: Count of alive walkers in swarm k ∈ {1,2}

implicit_assumptions.text: High-error set H_k(ε) is well-defined for interaction range ε
Positional variance V_Var,x is computed in x-dimension

section: ## 6. The Geometry of Error: From System Error to a Guaranteed Geometric Structure

registry_context.section_id: ## 6. The Geometry of Error: From System Error to a Guaranteed Geometric Structure

label: cor-cloning-pressure-target-set
title: Cloning Pressure on the Target Set
nl_statement: For any walker i in the critical target set I_target = I_11 ∩ U_k ∩ H_k(ε), its total cloning probability p_{k,i} in the high-variance swarm k is bounded below by the N-uniform constant p_u(ε) > 0.
content_markdown:
:label: cor-cloning-pressure-target-set

For any walker $i$ in the **critical target set**, $I_{\text{target}} = I_{11} \cap U_k \cap H_k(\epsilon)$, its total cloning probability in the high-variance swarm $k$ is also bounded below by the same N-uniform constant:

$$
p_{k,i} \ge p_u(\epsilon) > 0
raw_directive:
5007: This powerful lemma guarantees that every walker identified as "unfit" is under significant, quantifiable pressure to be cloned. We can now extend this guarantee directly to our critical target population.
5008: 
5009: :::{prf:corollary} Cloning Pressure on the Target Set
5010: :label: cor-cloning-pressure-target-set
5011: 
5012: For any walker $i$ in the **critical target set**, $I_{\text{target}} = I_{11} \cap U_k \cap H_k(\epsilon)$, its total cloning probability in the high-variance swarm $k$ is also bounded below by the same N-uniform constant:
5013: 
5014: $$
5015: p_{k,i} \ge p_u(\epsilon) > 0
5016: $$

hypotheses.text: Walker i is in the critical target set I_target = I_11 ∩ U_k ∩ H_k(ε)

conclusion.text: The total cloning probability p_{k,i} in swarm k is bounded below by p_u(ε) > 0

variables.name: walker index
variables.description: Index of a walker in the critical target set

variables.name: swarm index
variables.description: Index of the high-variance swarm

variables.name: epsilon
variables.description: Parameter defining the high-variance threshold

variables.name: cloning probability
variables.description: Total cloning probability for walker i in swarm k

variables.name: uniform lower bound
variables.description: N-uniform constant lower bound on cloning probability

implicit_assumptions.text: The critical target set I_target is a non-empty subset of unfit walkers in high-variance swarms
The previous lemma provides the bound p_u(ε) > 0 for unfit walkers in U_k
All referenced sets I_11, U_k, H_k(ε) are well-defined and disjoint where necessary

label: cor-structural-error-contraction
title: Structural Error Contraction
nl_statement: Under the same conditions as the positional variance contraction theorem, the structural error satisfies \(\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{struct}}(S'_1, S'_2)] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{struct}}) V_{\text{struct}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{struct}}\).
content_markdown:
:label: cor-structural-error-contraction

Under the same conditions as {prf:ref}`thm-positional-variance-contraction`, the structural error also contracts:

$$
\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{struct}}(S'_1, S'_2)] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{struct}}) V_{\text{struct}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{struct}}
$$
raw_directive:
6855: The positional variance contraction has immediate consequences for the structural error $V_{\text{struct}}$.
6856: 
6857: :::{prf:corollary} Structural Error Contraction
6858: :label: cor-structural-error-contraction
6859: 
6860: Under the same conditions as {prf:ref}`thm-positional-variance-contraction`, the structural error also contracts:
6861: 
6862: $$
6863: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{struct}}(S'_1, S'_2)] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{struct}}) V_{\text{struct}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{struct}}
6864: $$
6865:

hypotheses.text: Under the same conditions as Theorem thm-positional-variance-contraction

conclusion.text: The structural error contracts: $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{struct}}(S'_1, S'_2)] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{struct}}) V_{\text{struct}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{struct}}$

label: cor-bounded-boundary-exposure
title: Bounded Boundary Exposure in Equilibrium
nl_statement: Under the drift inequality, the long-term boundary exposure is bounded by C_b / κ_b.
content_markdown:
:label: cor-bounded-boundary-exposure

Under the drift inequality from {prf:ref}`thm-boundary-potential-contraction`, the long-term boundary exposure is bounded:

$$
\limsup_{t \to \infty} \mathbb{E}[W_b(S_t)] \leq \frac{C_b}{\kappa_b}
$$
raw_directive:
7552: The boundary potential contraction has important consequences for swarm survival.
7553: 
7554: :::{prf:corollary} Bounded Boundary Exposure in Equilibrium
7555: :label: cor-bounded-boundary-exposure
7556: 
7557: Under the drift inequality from {prf:ref}`thm-boundary-potential-contraction`, the long-term boundary exposure is bounded:
7558: 
7559: $$
7560: \limsup_{t \to \infty} \mathbb{E}[W_b(S_t)] \leq \frac{C_b}{\kappa_b}
7561: $$
7562:

hypotheses.text: Under the drift inequality from thm-boundary-potential-contraction

conclusion.text: The long-term boundary exposure is bounded

variables.name: boundary potential
variables.description: Boundary exposure function for swarm state

variables.name: swarm state
variables.description: Swarm configuration at time t

variables.name: time
variables.description: Continuous time parameter

variables.name: constant C_b
variables.description: Positive constant in drift bound

variables.name: kappa_b
variables.description: Positive contraction rate

implicit_assumptions.text: The swarm system satisfies the conditions for the referenced drift inequality

label: cor-extinction-suppression
title: Exponentially Suppressed Extinction Probability
nl_statement: The boundary potential contraction exponentially suppresses the probability of catastrophic boundary crossing events. Specifically, for any ε > 0, there exists N₀ such that for all N > N₀, the probability of extinction in one step is O(e^{-N · const}).
content_markdown:
:label: cor-extinction-suppression

The boundary potential contraction exponentially suppresses the probability of catastrophic boundary crossing events. Specifically, for any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists $N_0$ such that for all $N > N_0$:

$$
P(\text{extinction in one step}) = O(e^{-N \cdot \text{const}})
$$
raw_directive:
7595: :::
7596: 
7597: :::{prf:corollary} Exponentially Suppressed Extinction Probability
7598: :label: cor-extinction-suppression
7599: 
7600: The boundary potential contraction exponentially suppresses the probability of catastrophic boundary crossing events. Specifically, for any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists $N_0$ such that for all $N > N_0$:
7601: 
7602: $$
7603: P(\text{extinction in one step}) = O(e^{-N \cdot \text{const}})
7604: $$
7605:

hypotheses.text: for any ε > 0, there exists N₀ such that for all N > N₀ under boundary potential contraction

conclusion.text: P(extinction in one step) = O(e^{-N · const})

label: cor-component-bounds-vw
title: Component-Wise Bounds on Inter-Swarm Error
nl_statement: The expected location and structural error components under the clone measure are bounded by constants C_loc and C_struct, respectively.
raw_directive:
7976: For completeness, we state the separate bounds on the location and structural components.
7977: 
7978: :::{prf:corollary} Component-Wise Bounds on Inter-Swarm Error
7979: :label: cor-component-bounds-vw
7980: 
7981: The location and structural error components satisfy:
7982: 
7983: $$
7984: \begin{aligned}
7985: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{loc}}] &\leq C_{\text{loc}} \\
7986: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{struct}}] &\leq C_{\text{struct}}
7987: \end{aligned}
7988: $$
7989:

conclusion.text: The location and structural error components satisfy \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{loc}}] \leq C_{\text{loc}} and \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{struct}}] \leq C_{\text{struct}}.

variables.name: location error
variables.description: Change in potential due to location errors.

variables.name: location bound constant
variables.description: Upper bound constant for location error expectation.

variables.name: structural error
variables.description: Change in potential due to structural errors.

variables.name: structural bound constant
variables.description: Upper bound constant for structural error expectation.

variables.name: clone expectation
variables.description: Expectation with respect to the clone measure.

implicit_assumptions.text: C_loc and C_struct are non-negative constants defined in prior context.
The clone measure is a probability measure over configurations.
